text: - It's Trevor James.
Today, I'm at a local za jiang mian place,
which means mixed sauce noodles.

And their specialty here is
the huang dou za jiang mian.
So, the yellow bean za jiang mian.
It's really good. This is my lunch spot.
A lot of the time I'll come here
because the noodles are so good.
So let's go in there, have a try!
(upbeat funky music)
(speaking in Mandarin)

This greasy little joint
is a family operation
since last year,
when the whole family moved from Chonqing

and bring the locals of
Chongdou their local spice.
In particular, these pea noodles.
It all starts out with some sesame,

a numbing Sichuan peppercorn,
and an empty bowl.
A little garlic, soy sauce, and then--
(chef speaking in Mandarin)
- [Trevor] Now here comes the magic.

Add those noodles, those
boiled yellow peas on top,
some of their special "jiang" sauce,

which is mainly pork, broad
beans, chili oil, and sugar,
garnish it up, boom!
Oh, xiexie. Oh, look at that.

Okay, so I've got the
huang dou za jiang mian.
So it's really important to mix it up.
See the noodles? They need mixing.
So there's pork, garlic,
hot chili oil,
the yellow peas, which are essential,
because they make it creamy,

and a lot of that spice
and their secret sauce.
He wouldn't tell me.
Here we go.
(funky music)
Mmm, mmm, Yeah.
Oh, it's beautiful.
It's like a spicy mac 'n' cheese.

The peas taste almost
cheesy, and creamy as well,
combined with the saltiness of the pork,

and there's a little bit of
Sichuan peppercorn in there,
so it's got that numbing ma,
they call it ma in Sichuan, flavor.
So it's numbing, actually my mouth
is tingling a little bit right now.
That's the Sichuan specialty.
You come to Sichuan, Chengdu,

your mouth is gonna numb,
almost all the meals you eat.

My buddy in the back
there, he's busy right now,

but he makes a really good
huang dou za jiang mian.
That was a beautiful bowl of noodles.
So creamy, so spicy, and numbing as well,
so let's go give the chef a thanks.
(speaking in Mandarin)
Oh, that was beautiful.

Thank you very much for watching
my food and travel videos.

I really appreciate all the
support you guys give me.

I'm gonna be posting every
Saturday night, 7 p.m. now.
New food... I'm so happy to be able
to eat food like this every week,

and I'm even happier
to share with you guys.
So thanks again, and please stay tuned
for more fun, travel, food videos.
